#summary How to run several Scalaris on one server with different config files.

= Introduction =

If you use "./boot.sh" and "./cs_local.sh" to run several Scalaris instances on the same server, they will by default share the same config files ("scalaris.cfg" and "scalaris.local.cfg"). The following shows how to specify different config files for different instances.

= Details =

You can specify the names of the config files as command line parameters. The relevant parameters are
{{{
-boot_cs config "scalaris.cfg"
-boot_cs local_config "scalaris.local.cfg"
-chordsharp config "scalaris.cfg"
-chordsharp local_config "scalaris.local.cfg"
}}}

You can e.g. change cs_local.sh as follows to use scalaris.local2.cfg for the second VM.
{{{
erl -setcookie "chocolate chip cookie" -pa ../contrib/yaws/ebin -pa ../ebin \
    -yaws embedded true -connect_all false -hidden \
    -chordsharp cs_port 14196 \
    -chordsharp yaws_port 8001 \
    -chordsharp local_config "\"scalaris.local2.cfg\"" \ #<-- new line
    -sname node@localhost -s chordsharp
}}}
